meanings.definition: To make a living or support oneself, especially with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: She was eking out a living by selling handmade crafts.
meanings.sent2: The family was eking out a living by working multiple jobs.
meanings.sent3: He tried eking out a living by selling seashells on the seashore.
meanings.sent4: The small business was eking out a living in the competitive market.
meanings.sent5: Eking out a living in the city was like navigating a maze of challenges.

meanings.definition: To obtain or create something with great effort or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The students were eking out answers to the difficult math problems.
meanings.sent2: She was eking out a solution to the complex puzzle.
meanings.sent3: He was eking out a plan to surprise his friend on her birthday.
meanings.sent4: The team was eking out a victory in the final moments of the game.
meanings.sent5: Eking out a masterpiece from a blank canvas required patience and skill.
